column4: damn i don't know how azureus could get even worse, their new "vuze" stuff is even more horrible to use
well ktorrent working fine with kde-libs so i'm off with it for now, just looking for more lightweighted one
btlaunchmanycurses (bittornado)

transmission didn't allow me to select which files i wanted inside the torrent
than ktorrent?
maybe i'll give it a try
as for audio playing, any good alternative to amarok ?
normal audio
yeah it's a bit heavy for what i want (but nice though)
the day linux get a good daytrading analysis software it's gonna be perfect for me, no more vbox ;_;
too bad qtstalker is so limited :
also any good alternative for irc client? i really have trouble with xchat, back to mirc with wine ~
i use irssi when i run a client with ssh
because i'm used to it, have my scripts, my habits, and it's hard to change after what.. 10years? lol
Try xchat proper (not xchat-gnome) there's a surprising difference
there's a gui version of irssi or still ol good terminal one
terminal is a GUI version ;)
well i understand myself :D
yeah that's why i'm asking, but to go back to client line, or use xchat that left me weird aftertaste :D
i was hoping to find something that i can easily put down to tray and that tell me when i have notice and such
as much as I shudder to say it.. have you tried pidgin?
